intro: Quamoclit × leucantha, commonly known as the white-flowered false hellebore, is a hybrid plant in the Araceae family. It is characterized by its striking white or pale yellow spatulate leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments, such as woodland areas or stream banks. It is native to the eastern United States and is often found in the Appalachian region. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain areas.
